replies.body: Fizz and Xin are definitely the best tower divers.

"What tower?"





Edit: This isn't a comprehensive list; I just named the first ten or so that stick out to me.  
Feel free to comment your favorite tower divers diving diverse towers!  
Just don't say that I "forgot" so-and-so.

how is it balanced for him to have over 5k health all that armor and still do that much damage?
what damage? he did nothing late. {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

His W is all he needs for dmg. Sure fighter Kled rapes your ass in seconds. But Tank Kled can consistently trade with you over and over and over. Eventually your health is zero and Skaarl's is still half.
This sounds familiar... {{champion:245}}
This sounds familiar...{{champion:420}} {{champion:136}} {{champion:245}}{{champion:5}} {{champion:74}}  {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
yes it does... {{champion:122}}
or{{champion:83}}
how many defensive abilities does Kled have?

Potentially, 5

His passive can restore 80% Skaarls HP (Skaarl Base HP + 100% bonus HP).

His Mounted Q applies a pretty helty slow, so if you get out of range before you pull, you can have a 1.5 second 60% slow to run away with.

His unmounted Q knocks you back.

His E is a dash.

His R is a Chaaaaaaaaaaaaarge!!!

Short of the obvious passive mechanic, nothing you just mentioned is a defensive skill. That's all utility. Defensive skills are like Poppy's W passive and Active, shen's shield, morg shield, Lulu ult . . . Basically anything that actually actively bolsters your literal defenses, or something like Fiora's parry and yasuo's windwall that actively block/dodge an enemy attack. Movement impairing effects are crowd control, which is inherently utility.

I do apologize if this seems rude but, you do realize that you can use utility and mobility defensively right? as in "abilities that can be used help him survive"

again sorry If it seems dickish but your POV seems meshed.

feel free to correct me if I'm wrong. I don't even remember half your comment by the time I finished typing this.
his unmounted Q knocks him back not other people..

That is what I said.

His unmounted Q knocks you back.

In this context, "you" refers to the Kled player.

Your passive math is all wrong. It's a flat 50-80% depending on champ lvl. the 100% bonus hp is already applied to that. 

Q doesnt knock you back it pulls them towards you at an increasingly shortening tether. Meaning you are putting them right on top of you if the pull gets applied.

E is a dash yes but the second part of it can only be cast towards the target hit.

R hits in a wide AOE upon casting so unless you are already pretty far away from them casting hit will just pull you towards them.

While they can be used defensively other then the dash they are all unreliable to use unless its an offensive manor.

The passive math is fine... 
Getting skaarl back restores up to 80% of Skaarl's HP, which is equal to Skaarl's base hp plus your bonus HP.

One of his Q's DOES knock you back.

The shortening tether gets short enough by the end of the duration that Kled pretty much never pulls in someone he doesn't want to pull in. The slow is mediocre as a defensive tool, but it is there.

The second dash is rarely used defensively. That said, you can use it like that if there is a monster in your escape path to dash through.

Your ult is very wide, but Skaarl won't turn around to tackle a target that is behind the duo unless they are pretty much on top of you (like a Sion ult). That semicircle range indicator you see while ulting is the area in which Skaarl will give the first enemy a flying hug.
